item.title: 普拉达旗下品牌范思哲任命艾莱亚设计师彼得·穆利尔为创意总监
item.description: 意大利时尚品牌范思哲（Versace）去年被竞争对手普拉达（Prada）收购，该公司宣布任命历峰集团旗下品牌Alaïa的离任设计师彼得·穆利尔（Pieter Mulier）为新任创意总监。【原文：Versace, the Italian fashion brand which last year was acquired by rival Prada , said it had appointed as its new creative director Pieter Mulier, the outgoing designer of Richemont-owned Alaia.】

item.title: 随着房主补贴到期，美国屋顶太阳能安装商裁员重组
item.description: 美国住宅太阳能企业正为今年业务量大幅下滑做准备。此前推动该行业十余年快速增长的联邦税收抵免政策已到期，这将引发裁员、重组及部分企业倒闭。【原文：U.S. residential solar companies are preparing for a steep drop in business this year after the expiration of a federal tax credit that helped drive more than a decade of rapid growth, prompting layoffs, restructurings and some company failures.】

item.title: 康菲石油因油价疲软未达季度盈利预期
item.description: 康菲石油公司周四公布的第四季度利润低于华尔街预期，原因是原油价格下跌抵消了石油产量增长和成本节约措施带来的积极影响。【原文：ConocoPhillips missed Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter profit on Thursday, as lower crude prices countered a rise in oil production and cost-saving efforts.】

item.title: 大众汽车在2025年超越特斯拉，成为欧洲电动汽车销量冠军。
item.description: 据JATO Dynamics周四发布的数据显示，2025年大众汽车在欧洲纯电动汽车销量超越特斯拉。此前中国比亚迪已于去年取代特斯拉成为全球最大电动汽车制造商，此次又使这家美国车企遭遇新的挫折。【原文：Volkswagen overtook Tesla in sales of fully-electric cars in Europe in 2025, data from JATO Dynamics showed on Thursday, another setback for the U.S. automaker after China's BYD dethroned it as the world's top EV maker last year.】

item.title: 五角大楼要求调查SpaceX公司潜在的中国所有权问题
item.description: 据路透社获得的一封信函显示，美国民主党参议员敦促五角大楼立即对SpaceX展开审查。信中援引潜在国家安全风险为由，指控中国投资者已秘密收购这家私营火箭制造商的股权。【原文：Democratic U.S. senators urged the Pentagon to conduct an immediate review of SpaceX amid allegations that Chinese investors have secretly acquired stakes in the closely held rocket maker, citing potential national security risks, according to a letter seen by Reuters.】

item.title: 私募巨头KKR报告管理费上升，交易费下降
item.description: 投资公司KKR周四报告称，第四季度管理新资本所获的费用收入有所增长，但交易产生的费用收入下降，同时一项一次性费用拖累了关键盈利指标。【原文：Investment firm KKR reported a rise in fourth-quarter income from fees it earns on managing new capital on Thursday, but booked lower fees earned from transactions, while a one-off charge weighed on a key profit metric.】

item.title: 汤森路透报告显示第四季度营收增长
item.description: 汤森路透周四公布第四季度营收增长，得益于其法律、税务与会计以及企业业务板块的业绩表现。与此同时，投资者正评估人工智能企业进军其核心市场的潜在影响。【原文：Thomson Reuters reported higher fourth quarter revenue on Thursday, boosted by results from its legal, tax and accounting and corporates businesses, as investors weigh the impact of artificial intelligence companies moving into its key markets.】

item.title: Spotify将通过与Bookshop.org的合作，允许用户在应用内购买实体书籍
item.description: Spotify周四宣布，将通过与在线零售商Bookshop.org的合作，在其流媒体平台上开始销售实体书籍，标志着其业务意外地扩展到有声读物领域之外。【原文：Spotify said on Thursday it will begin selling physical books on its streaming platform through a partnership with online retailer Bookshop.org, marking an unexpected expansion beyond its audiobooks business.】

item.title: 挂毯公司上调年度预测，Tabby手袋热潮助推假日季度销售暴涨
item.description: 塔佩斯特里公司周四再次上调年度盈利目标，此前其Tabby手袋需求强劲，助力这家平价奢侈品零售商轻松超越假日季度预期。【原文：Tapestry raised its annual earnings targets on Thursday for a second time after strong demand for its Tabby handbags helped the affordable luxury retailer comfortably beat holiday-quarter estimates.】

item.title: 西班牙首相桑切斯：我们不会在社交媒体禁令问题上被科技寡头左右
item.description: 西班牙首相佩德罗·桑切斯周四表示，科技公司无法动摇西班牙政府的决心，政府计划禁止年轻人使用社交媒体平台。他指责"科技寡头"散布关于西班牙的谎言。【原文：Tech companies will not sway the will of the Spanish government as it intends to ban young people from social media platforms, Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said on Thursday, accusing "tech oligarchs" of spreading lies about Spain.】

item.title: 晨间竞价：卖出催生卖出
item.description: 当今美国及全球市场中真正重要的因素【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 水泥制造商Cemex季度盈利因削减成本和提高价格而增长
item.description: 墨西哥水泥制造商Cemex周四报告称，受成本削减措施和产品价格上涨推动，其第四季度核心利润增长16%，但业绩仍低于分析师预期。【原文：Mexican cement maker Cemex reported on Thursday a 16% climb in fourth-quarter core earnings, supported by cost-cutting measures and higher product prices, though results fell short of analysts' estimates.】

item.title: 美国大型银行在政策之争加剧之际，正加强在华盛顿的游说力量。
item.description: 路透社对披露数据和行业游说者的分析显示，去年美国大型银行的游说支出激增12%，创十余年来最大增幅。随着特朗普政府执政期间华盛顿重大政策动荡加剧，这些银行正加紧努力应对政策变化。【原文：Big U.S. banks' lobbying spend jumped 12% last year, the most in more than a decade, as they intensified efforts to navigate major policy flux in Washington under President Donald Trump's administration, according to a Reuters analysis of disclosure data and industry lobbyists.】

item.title: KKR将以14亿美元收购Arctos
item.description: 投资公司KKR周四宣布，将以14亿美元收购Arctos。【原文：Investment firm KKR said on Thursday that it would buy Arctos in a deal valued at $1.4 billion.】

item.title: 雅诗兰黛上调全年盈利预期，因中国市场销售改善
item.description: 化妆品制造商雅诗兰黛周四上调了年度利润预期，押注中国市场销售改善及首席执行官斯蒂芬·德拉法维里实施的转型计划将带来收益。【原文：Cosmetics maker Estee Lauder raised its annual profit forecast on Thursday, betting on improving China sales and benefits from CEO Stephane de La Faverie's turnaround plans.】

item.title: 沃什可能难以为美联储制定新的行动准则
item.description: 自离开美联储的15年来，凯文·沃什屡屡强调：理想的中央银行应尽可能减少对经济的干预，专注于控制通胀，并部分受制于政策规则，而非让官员们充当自由放任的"统治者"。【原文：In the 15 years since leaving the Federal Reserve, Kevin Warsh has lectured often that the ideal central bank is one with the smallest possible footprint in the economy, focused intently on controlling inflation, and bound in part by policy rules rather than letting officials act as free-ranging "overlords."】

item.title: 星链助力SpaceX发展，或将推出手机及更多互联网服务
item.description: 知情人士透露，随着SpaceX预计今年上市，该公司正计划拓展其创收业务Starlink，以进军新市场，包括推出Starlink手机、直连设备互联网服务以及太空追踪服务。【原文：With a SpaceX IPO expected this year, the company has plans for its revenue-generating Starlink business that could expand its reach into new markets, including a Starlink phone, direct-to-device internet and a space-tracking service, sources familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 标普500指数和纳斯达克指数期货走势低迷，市场正消化谷歌母公司Alphabet的人工智能支出计划。
item.description: 周四美国股指期货走势平淡，投资者权衡了谷歌母公司Alphabet惊人的支出计划与亮眼的季度业绩；而高通公司因发布悲观预测而股价下跌。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were largely muted on Thursday as investors weighed Alphabet's blowout spending plans against stellar quarterly results, while Qualcomm dropped after a dour forecast.】

item.title: 中国电动汽车制造商蔚来预计将实现首次经调整的经营利润。
item.description: 中国电动汽车制造商蔚来周四表示，预计将在2025年第四季度实现公司成立以来的首次经调整营业利润，这得益于汽车销量的增长和成本控制措施提升了盈利能力。【原文：Chinese electric-vehicle maker Nio said on Thursday it expects to post its first-ever adjusted operating profit in the fourth quarter of 2025, driven by higher vehicle sales and cost controls that improved profitability.】

item.title: 德国卡特尔办公室禁止亚马逊实施价格管控
item.description: 德国反垄断机构已禁止亚马逊在其德国电商平台对线上零售商实施价格上限，并首次追缴数百万欧元——该机构称这笔资金是这家美国公司通过反竞争行为获得的。【原文：Germany's cartel office has prohibited Amazon from imposing price caps on online retailers in its German marketplace and for the first time claimed several million euros that it said the U.S. firm obtained through anti-competitive behavior.】

item.title: 欧盟称苹果广告和苹果地图不应被纳入《数字市场法案》监管范围
item.description: 欧盟委员会表示，苹果广告和苹果地图不应被纳入欧盟《数字市场法案》的监管范围，理由是苹果地图在欧盟的使用率相对较低，且苹果广告在欧盟在线广告市场的规模有限。【原文：The European Commission said Apple Ads and Apple Maps should not be designated under the EU’s Digital Markets Act, citing Apple Maps' relatively low usage in the EU and the limited scale of Apple Ads in the EU online advertising market.】

item.title: 联合国儿童基金会呼吁将描绘儿童性虐待的人工智能内容定为刑事犯罪
item.description: 联合国儿童基金会周三呼吁各国将制作人工智能生成儿童性虐待内容的行为定为犯罪，称其对人工智能图像性化儿童数量增加的报道深感震惊。【原文：The United Nations children's agency UNICEF on Wednesday called for countries to criminalize the creation of AI-generated child sexual abuse content, saying it was alarmed by reports of an increase in the number of artificial intelligence images sexualizing children.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称先正达计划2026年在香港上市，募资规模或达100亿美元
item.description: 知情人士透露，先正达集团正计划于今年在香港上市，融资规模可能高达100亿美元。这家瑞士农化与种子集团有望成为2026年全球规模最大的首次公开募股（IPO）之一。【原文：Syngenta Group is targeting a Hong Kong listing that could raise as much as $10 billion this year, two sources with knowledge of the deal said, setting the Swiss agrichemicals and seeds group on course for one of the world's biggest IPOs in 2026.】

item.title: 中国警告称开源AI代理OpenClaw存在安全风险
item.description: 中国工业和信息化部周四警告称，近期风靡全球的开源人工智能代理OpenClaw若配置不当，可能带来重大安全风险，使用户面临网络攻击和数据泄露的威胁。【原文：China's industry ministry on Thursday warned that the OpenClaw open-source AI agent, which gained global popularity in recent weeks, could pose significant security risks when improperly configured and expose users to cyberattacks and data breaches.】

item.title: 韩联社报道，Coupang确认又有16.5万韩国用户个人信息遭泄露
item.description: 韩联社周四报道，韩国电商企业Coupang表示已确认该国另有16.5万用户个人信息遭泄露。【原文：South Korean e-commerce company Coupang said it had confirmed the leak of personal data of an additional 165,000 users in the country, Yonhap news reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 英国将与微软合作开发深度伪造检测系统
item.description: 英国政府周四表示，将与微软公司、学术界及专家合作开发一套系统，用于识别网络上的深度伪造内容。此举旨在制定应对有害及欺骗性人工智能生成内容的标准。【原文：Britain will work with Microsoft , academics and experts to develop a system to spot deepfake material online, the government said on Thursday, as it moves to set standards for tackling harmful and deceptive AI-generated content.】

item.title: Anthropic的人工智能推进引发分析师对IT服务收入的担忧
item.description: 分析师警告称，人工智能的快速发展——部分源于Anthropic公司最新的自动化推动——可能从结构上侵蚀IT行业高利润的应用服务收入，从而给盈利和估值带来下行风险。【原文：Rapid advances in artificial intelligence, triggered in part by Anthropic's latest automation push, could structurally erode the IT sector's high-margin application services revenues, creating downside risks to earnings and valuations, analysts warn.】

item.title: 台湾富士康预测第一季度业绩强劲
item.description: 台湾富士康周四表示，对第一季度业绩抱有强烈预期，此前该公司报告1月份营收同比增长35.5%。【原文：Taiwan's Foxconn on Thursday flagged strong expectations for its first quarter performance, after reporting a 35.5% year-on-year rise in January revenue.】

item.title: 台湾晶圆厂ASE预计其先进封装业务将在2026年实现翻番，达到32亿美元规模。
item.description: 全球最大的芯片封装和测试服务商亚德诺科技控股公司周四表示，预计其尖端先进封装业务规模将在2026年翻番，达到32亿美元。【原文：ASE Technology Holding , the world's largest chip packaging and testing provider, on Thursday said it expects its leading-edge advanced packaging business to double in size to $3.2 billion in 2026.】

item.title: 为取悦特朗普，中国面临增购美国大豆价格上涨的压力
item.description: 中国大豆进口商若增购800万吨美国大豆，将面临大幅增加的成本。此前美国总统特朗普曾表示北京方面正在考虑增购。与此同时，竞争对手巴西正值出口旺季，其大豆供应价格远低于美国。【原文：Chinese soybean importers face much higher costs to bring in an additional 8 million metric tons of U.S. cargoes, whose purchase President Donald Trump has said Beijing is weighing, as rival Brazilian supplies are far cheaper in their peak export season.】
